subSubSection.paragraph:
FIELD MATERIAL . —
Burkina Faso
•
3 ♀ ( SVL 39.9-47.7 mm ); Koti ; 11.38788°N , – 3.06401°W ;
310 m a.s.l.
;
10.X.2017
; H. J. Ayoro leg.; in a small water near a garbage dump; hand capture
•
1 ♀ ( SVL 40.7 mm ); same locality;
27.IX.2018
; same collector as for preceding; in a small pond in a bush; hand capture
•
2 ♀ ( SVL 45.1- 46.8 mm ), 2 subadults ( SVL 34.3-37.1 mm ); Loumbila , downstream from the Loumbila dam; 12.491656°N , – 1.40244°W ;
280 m a.s.l.
;
14.VII.2017
; H. J. Ayoro & A. Ohler leg.; in an irrigated well; hand capture
•
4 ♀ ( SVL 41.7-58.5 mm ), 4 subadults ( SVL 23.5-36.7 mm ); Tuy province , Fafo ; 11.33470°N , – 3.01947°W ;
300 m a.s.l.
;
5.XI.2018
; H. J. Ayoro leg.; in the backwater of Fafo ; hand capture
•
2 individuals; Ouagadougou , University of Joseph Ki-Zerbo ; 12.378350°N , – 1.50128°W ;
295 m a.s.l.
;
12.VIII.2018
; same collector as for preceding; in the water of the channel near the university restaurant; visual observation
.

DESCRIPTION. — 39 specimens examined. Adult and subadult specimens of
Xenopus fischbergi
with flat head and smooth body. Presence of a long subocular tentacle and three black claws on toes. In alcohol, the back and limbs greyish to brown with few darker brown spots. The belly whitish, some darker spots occasionally on the throat and on the thighs; whitish zones usually yellow in life. Previous West African reports of this species under the name
Xenopus muelleri .
